byline.contributor: Amy Chozick reported from Portsmouth, Patrick Healy from New York, and Yamiche Alcindor from Cleveland.
byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK, PATRICK HEALY and YAMICHE ALCINDOR

abstract: Sen Bernie Sanders endorses Hillary Clinton for Democratic presidential nomination, clearing last major obstacle to forming united party front ahead of election; Clinton still faces challenges in gaining support of liberals and independents who backed Sanders and will be closely watching for any deviation from progressive agenda.
lead_paragraph: Whether Mrs. Clinton can also win over the 13 million Sanders voters will be one of her biggest challenges at the party’s convention and in the weeks ahead.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders Endorses Hillary Clinton, Hoping to Unify Democrats
headline.print_headline: With Sanders Endorsing Clinton, Democrats Put On United Front

snippet: Whether Mrs. Clinton can also win over the 13 million Sanders voters will be one of her biggest challenges at the party’s convention and in the weeks ahead....
